data.title: News and communications
data.meta_description: Find news and communications from government
data.text:
Mr Bharat Joshi has been appointed His Majesty’s Ambassador to the Republic of Angola.

Updated: 20 August 2024

The Environment Agency has accepted an Enforcement Undertaking from a West Midlands waste operator following a fire that occurred in September 2022.

Updated: 20 August 2024

Details of completed inspections awaiting publication, and active inspections.

Updated: 20 August 2024

The move follows consultation with the wider advertising sector.

Updated: 20 August 2024

Interim Independent Chief Inspector David Bolt provides an update about his priorities in the role and his plans for new inspection topics.

Updated: 20 August 2024

Director who previously committed bankruptcy offences is sentenced for fraud and failing to keep accounting records

Updated: 20 August 2024

Tiverton security company, Kaba Ltd, is to pay more than £24,000 to an environmental charity for failing to comply with packaging waste regulations.

Updated: 20 August 2024

Child Benefit can be claimed for children after they turn 16 if they are staying on in approved education or training.

Updated: 20 August 2024

Partnership project transforms 17 hectares of floodplain grassland into complex wetland habitat at Manor Farm. Flourishing wildlife and flood management.

Updated: 20 August 2024

The Prime Minister and Welsh First Minister will supercharge efforts to make Britain a clean energy superpower today, by investing in homegrown energy to grow the economy, create jobs, boost skills, and strengthen our energy…

Updated: 20 August 2024

She helps shape the defence and security landscape with her work on the ethics, law and governance of artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities.

Updated: 20 August 2024

Pensioners urged to check if they could be eligible for Pension Credit to secure the Winter Fuel Payment, worth up to £300 per household.

Updated: 20 August 2024

Among the three students receiving fully-funded scholarships to UK masters programmes in 2024 is Canada’s first-ever Indigenous Chevening Scholar.

Updated: 19 August 2024

The British Embassy held a festival to share the experience of UK culture with its gastronomy and art, in collaboration with British companies in Guatemala.

Updated: 19 August 2024

The Tata Steel / Port Talbot Transition Board met for the eighth time on 15 August 2024, the second under the new government.

Updated: 19 August 2024

Apply for prior authority to incur disbursements and Apply for Extension of Upper Limit are the replacement services for CRM4 and CRM5 eForms.

Updated: 19 August 2024

We are pleased to announce that the Office for Place will be hosting Places at Pace, our first online mini-conference, on 18 September from 10am to 12pm.

Updated: 19 August 2024

The Prime Minister has arrived in Cardiff this afternoon for his first in-person meeting with First Minister Eluned Morgan since she took up the role this month.

Updated: 19 August 2024

The first armed forces families move into their new homes at Imjin Barracks following the handover of the first wave of properties.

Updated: 19 August 2024
